qas.question: What former Soviet Union continued child labour programs?
What was the main source of income for Islam Karimov?
Did they have daily quotas for cotton?

answers.text: daily quotas of 20 to 60 kg of raw cotton

qas.question: What are the 2016 estimates for child labour in regards to cotton picking?

context: Out of former Soviet Union republics <a0_0>Uzbekistan<a0_0/> continued and expanded the program of child labour on industrial scale to increase profits on the main source of Islam Karimov's income, <a1_0>cotton harvesting<a1_0/>. In September, when school normally starts, the classes are suspended and children are sent to cotton fields for work, where they are assigned <a2_0>daily quotas of 20 to 60 kg of raw cotton<a2_0/> they have to collect. This process is repeated in spring, when collected cotton needs to be hoed and weeded. In 2006 it is estimated that <a3_0>2.7 million<a3_0/> children were forced to work this way.
